gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਪੰਥ ਗਹੇ ਜਮਪੁਰਿ ਪੰਥ ਮੇਟੇ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਸੰਗ ਪੰਚ ਦੂਤ ਸੰਗ ਤਿਅਾਗੇ ਹੈ
transliteration: Gurmukhi Pand Gahay Jamapuri Pand Maytay , Gursikh Sang Panch Doot Sang Tiaagay Hai ?
translation: Treading the path of Guru's percepts, a Sikh is freed from the fear of death. By keeping company of the holy Sangat (congregation) even vices like lust, anger, avarice, attachment and pride are shed.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਨ ਸਰਨਿ ਗੁਰ ਕਰਮ ਭਰਮ ਖੋੲੇ ਦਰਸ ਅਕਾਲ ਕਾਲ ਕੰਟਕ ਭੈ ਭਾਗੇ ਹੈ
transliteration: Charan Sarani Gur Karam Bharam Khoay , Daras Akaal Kaal Kantak Bhai Bhaagay Hai ?
translation: By taking the refuge of Satguru, one destroys all effects of the past deeds. And beholding the God-like form of Satguru, the fear of death disappears.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ੳੁਪਦੇਸ ਵੇਸ ਬਜ੍ਰ ਕਪਾਟ ਖੁਲੇ ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਮੂਰਛਤ ਮਨ ਜਾਗੇ ਹੈ
transliteration: Gur Oupadays Vays Bajr Kapaat Khulay , Sabad Surati Moorachhat Man Jaagay Hai ?
translation: Abiding by the sermons of the Satguru, all desires and apprehensions vanish. By engrossing the mind in the holy words of the Guru, the mammon-gripped unconscious mind becomes alert.

gurmukhi: ਕਿੰਚਤ ਕਟਾਛ ਕ੍ਰਿਪਾ ਸਰਬ ਨਿਧਾਨ ਪਾੲੇ ਜੀਵਨ ਮੁਕਤਿ ਗੁਰ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਲਿਵ ਲਾਗੇ ਹੈ ॥੫੭॥
transliteration: Kinchat Kataachh Kripaa Sarab Nidhaan Paaay , Jeevan Moukati Gur Giaan Liv Laagay Hai ?57?
translation: Even a subtle element of grace of the Satguru is no less than all the worldly treasures. By engrossing the mind in the word and Naam blessed by the Satguru, one achieves salvation while still alive and living life. (57)
